page.title: 02 **** LANDSCAPE ****
page.content: This area is within a region of{low {lying}land,less than 100m above sea_ level in most parts.Its highest point at the west side of the area is 152m above sea_level:Sweeney Mountain.From the summit of this the aspect below, over this area,and to the north and east,is one of very{gentle hills, scattered farms and settlements at regular intervals.This is a relatively unwooded landscape_most woodland in view is outside our area(apart from private parkland to the north).There is a continual pattern of agriculture throughout that part of the Shropshire Plain visible.Hills dominate the land_ scape to the west and south outside our area.The settlements in the area under survey are generally ribbon- shaped in form,following the route of the roads.
